body: Failure in maven was issue with nightly snapshot not yet being populated for 2.4.0 target.
Jenkins failures look like dep fetch issues at first glance. Didn't give a second glance.

Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote…
Maybe we can avoid introducing such a thing if we work on the specific pieces of the context that are needed. I think an `OutputReceiver` or some such is the only thing you need. For a long time we have wanted to separate that and eliminate context parameters - because they are just collections of other parameters anyhow, and redundant with the way that DoFn supports a mixed bag of parameters.

You don't really need a mock, since it is a POJO. I think either way the default/stub/mock should already be set up in `DoFnInvokersTest`. Or maybe those methods are in ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactoryTest, which covers the same logic since `DoFnInvokers` right now just delegates to it.
Moved it to the DoFnInvokersTest and used the default mock object. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-:-L43QhF7l9QavGGf2iwd:bvee08k)*

I haven't gotten "grade precommit" to run successfully on my machine even on master without my changes.  The dataflowRunnerPreCommit tests all fail.   I *assume* there is some creds or something that is needed as the failures are all:
```
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to get application default credentials. Please see https://developers.google.com/accounts/docs/application-default-credentials for details on how to specify credentials. This version of the SDK is dependent on the gcloud core component version 2015.02.05 or newer to be able to get credentials from the currently authorized user via gcloud auth.
	at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.gcp.auth.NullCredentialInitializer.throwNullCredentialException(NullCredentialInitializer.java:60)
```
but I don't see any info on the beam website on what to do about that.
I think that's reasonable. I'll submit that PR soon.
Alright, LGTM, thanks! Please rebase and then I can merge.

What was not working before this change? I could not make the logical connection between adding this equals method and supporting the choices argument. I thought that we were already passing all these as is to argparse here (https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/21623d892302717a3ad5b3dbc447ebc38268bb29/sdks/python/apache_beam/options/pipeline_options.py#L102).
Yes, that is a good point. WordCountIT is run on all the runners in precommit. We should assemble a target that does everything other than the ITs.
Looks like there's a checkstyle problem.
Great, I've made the changes and squashed it down to 1 commit.
This looks good to me now. And, of course, rebase :-)

Hi, while doing some fixes to make Java code idiomatic in the move to Java 8 I also added this fixes. Sorry I was not aware of this PR and its associated JIRA. My excuses @wtanaka. I am closing it for good. Feel free to open a new PR for unsolved issues (there are still some).

I am merging even if not green, the issue is unrelated to this PR and the respective tests did pass.
Thanks a lot @pawel-kaczmarczyk !

The `choices` feature of argparse was not working. The reason is that we always override the `type` of an option to be `StaticValueProvider`, via this line: 
`[kwargs['type'] = _static_value_provider_of(value_type)]`,
and the way `choices` works is to compare user input with type applied to the elements in the `choices` list. For example, if the `choices` are ['a', 'b'], and user inputs 'a', internally, the check will be on `if StaticValueProvider(str, 'a') in ['a', 'b']`, which obviously will fail. This change makes sure that a `StaticValueProvider` can be compared with un underlying value.
@jkff I pushed two commits that address your review comments. Please, take a look on this.

@alanmyrvold @chamikaramj There is an option for pass tmp_dir indeed, you can see it in #4537.

But honestly it's just another walk-around for the main, unresolved, issue. And one more problem is that some workers are having different problem. Take a look on [build 85](https://builds.apache.org/view/A-D/view/Beam/job/beam_PerformanceTests_TextIOIT/85/console) of `beam_PerformanceTests_TextIOIT` - it's failing because it tries to install dependency that is not system-wide available.

@chamikaramj @alanmyrvold As mentioned in #4416 this change is ready. As you can see above, tests are running properly on various workers, including the ones with former permission denied issue and pip install issues. PTAL
+1 to changing your mind. Another alternative would be EMPTY. I though ZERO was the distribution with nothing but zeros in it.

@robertwb `EMPTY` could be good as it matches what [GaugeResult](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/a39960b131674e6c1d120a971b91b37226c88414/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/metrics/GaugeResult.java#L39) has -- although, still not a perfect analogue as `EmptyGaugeResult` just returns a value of -1.
hmm how about we go with IDENTITY_ELEMENT ?
Can you squash the commits into a single commit ?
Tried closing and reopening the pull request to trigger rerun of prechecks

The failure is because after we cut the 2.3.0 release branch, the archetype refers to nonexistent 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT until the nightly build runs. I kicked one off early just to get it. We should add that to the release guide actually.
